reviews.review: ce jeu est contre les loi de la phisique et tu s'amusera beaucoup en mode coop
сюжет на много красочнее чем в первой части, да и проходиться вторая часть в 3 раза дольше и интереснее
Кхм..Кхмм, прикольная башка за мной летала пол игры, а потом картошка вкусная
классная игра совету брать пряма сейчас со скидкой 90%!
Дешёвая, интересная головоломка, в которой можно неплохо провести время с другом. Иль просто пройти сюжетную линию в одиночной игре.

Очень интересная игра и цена отличная (особенно со скидкой). Проходится за 4-5 часов, но ощущения остаются как минимум на день. Больше всего понравилась отсутствие грани между добром и злом, по крайней мере я вовсе её не увидел. Всех героев можно спокойно отнести к нейтральным. Думаю ещё заценить совместный режим, благо он в игре присутствует

Купил на распродаже за 1$, игра полностью оправдала мои ожидания.
Прошёл на одном дыхании.
I feel like I'm being played, and somehow, that's a good thing. Quite the classic

Eine sehr gut gelungene Fortsetzung. Schade, dass es keinen dritten Teil bisher gibt. Die Spielmechanik ist einfach einzigartig und der Humor wurde auch nicht vergessen. Um die Geschichte jedoch komplett zu verstehen würde ich absolut jedem raten zuerst den ersten Teil zu spielen. Auch wenn die Qualitätsunterschiede enorm sind, fehlen einem ohne die Vorgeschichte einige wichtige Infos.
точно не для тупых но вроде совместку прошёл а одиночу....Ну удачи мне!
Best Puzzle Co-Op game that has ever made by human!

Si jugaste portal lo vas a disfrutar un poco mas pero si lo compras por separado no vas a tener problemas. Es un juego hermoso: tiene unos puzzles que te hacen pensar pero tampoco son frustrantes, resolverlos es satisfactorio y gratificante. Es entretenido y seguir la historia lo hace mucho mejor. Totalmente recomendado a cualquiera 10/10

лучше первой части в 100 раз,нормальные шутки, сюжет, перевод в конце концов и очень много вариантов назвать собеседницу жирной, советую брать пока есть скидка или без неё, но не скачивайте с торрента. купите и таким образом вы поддержите создателей этой игры

Scroll for English

[h1]Português[/h1]
Para resolver os puzzles, não é necessário ter jogado Portal. Entretanto, para acompanhar a história, é altamente recomendável que tenha zerado o primeiro jogo da série. Em termos de jogabilidade, nada mudou. É apenas a arma de portais e muitos puzzles. A diferença fica por conta da diversidade de elementos presentes no jogo atual: o primeiro contava com piscina ácida, turrets e cubos, e este conta com MUITOS outros gadgets (como túnel de luz, ponte de luz, cerca laser, rampa arremessadora, etc), além de ter puzzles bem mais longos e complexos.

A história tem algumas reviravoltas e faz você adentrar o mundo da Aperture. (SPOILER ALERT) [spoiler] Em Portal 1, existe uma sala com o calendário do ano 1983 (se não me engano), fazendo supor que aquele complexo estava operante naquela data. Em Portal 2, ao longo da jornada entramos numa parte desativada da Aperture, que servia para testes em datas distintas, indo desde 1950's até 1970's. GLaDOS e o idiota (esqueci o nome dele) vão contando certos detalhes, mas o charme fica por conta da narração automática feita pelo fundador da Aperture. Embora MUITO forçada, essas chamadas - influenciadas pelo Portal 1, que eram bem mais naturais - tem lá seu charme. [/spoiler] 

A música e os gráficos ficaram melhores. A ambientação é bem interessante e o jogo anda rápido - sem muitos caminhos a seguir, embora com alguns segredos a se encontrar, que apenas acrescentam à história - sem prejuízo para o gameplay. 

Vale a pena? Sim, se você tiver jogado o Portal 1, com certeza gostará desse, mesmo sendo muito longo e às vezes meio chato por ser repetitivo e cansativo. Mas vale a pena, sim. 
==============================
[h1]ENGLISH[/h1]
Have you ever played Portal? You don't have to had played it in order to know how to play Portal 2, since the game itself will teach you. But, in order to fully understand the story, I strongly advise you to complete the first game.

Talking about gameplay: nothing has changed from the first version. It's still the same portal gun and mechanics. The novelty here is the unusual ammount of gadgets on the rooms. In the first game, we could count acid pool, turrets, mobile platforms and cubes. In addition to those, in Portal 2 we have [spoiler] lasers, light bridges, light tunnels, throwing platform, 3 types of gel... I think there is more, but I can't remember. [/spoiler]

The graphics and soundtrack were improved - of course. And sure it is a beautiful game. It has a looooooong gameplay (way more than the previous game) and the story is filled with plot twists. SPOILER ALERT [spoiler] In Portal 1, we find ourselves inside a room - can't remember which one - that has a calendar with the year 1983 (I guess), so we can suppose that facility was operative back then. In Portal 2, we are taken to an abandoned portion of Aperture Science, with rooms dated back to the 1950's through 1970's. We can see how things were changing, how the discoveries affected the portal gun itself. Interesting. [/spoiler]

So, summarizing, it's a long game - not that long - filled with complexes puzzles (way more difficult than the first one, but nothing unsolvable - I completed all of them withouth walkthrough) and with some secrets that unveil the story - but won't jeopardize your gameplay if you don't find them. Is it worthy? I think so, even though I felt the game was a little boring - because of the repetitions. But, yeah, worth it!

Sorry for the English.
